Manual page for using_ploticus_interactively(PL)


DESCRIPTION

This page contains notes regarding ploticus' use as an interactive data display tool under X11.


X11 DISPLAYS

Ploticus will draw in an X11 window if the -x11 command line option is used. This is mostly intended for preview during development of data displays. The -pagesize command line option (or the pagesize attribute of proc page may be used to control the size of the window, and the -winloc command line option may be used to control the location of the upper-left corner of the window. Not supported are the standard X resources scheme and the standard X command line arguments such as -geometry.


USING VIEWERS SUCH AS GHOSTVIEW OR XV

If you have a Postscript viewer such as GhostView you can automatically invoke the viewer to display PostScript results using the -viewer command line option. Likewise, -viewer may be used to automatically invoke an image viewing tool such as XV.


CONTROLLING PLOTICUS FROM OTHER PROGRAMS

FUNCTIONS

Some functions are available that may be useful for interactive viewing under X11.


SEE ALSO
